Description: To resolve a Clean Air Act case, WEPCO agreed to spend up to $600 million to reduce emissions, pay a $3.2 million civil penalty and spend at least $20 million to finance an environmental mitigation project.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Description: The Wisconsin Public Service Corporation agreed to invest approximately $300 million in pollution control technology, pay a civil penalty of $1.2 million, and spend $6 million on environmental mitigation projects to resolve violations of the Clean Air Act.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Private Litigation Case Title: Luebke v. Wisconsin Electric Power Company et al
Downes v. Wisconsin Energy Corporation Retirement Account Plan

Company: Peoples Gas Light and Coke Co.
Description: Peoples Gas Light and Coke Company and its parent company, Integrys Energy Group, which is owned by WEC Energy Group Inc. agreed to pay a total of $18.75 million -- including $11 million in refunds to customers -- in settlement of allegations it hid costs for infrastructure replacement from the state.

Info Source: WPS to pay $65,000 in pollution penalties, Green Bay Press-Gazette, February 24, 2004 (via Nexis).

Description: Citation for alleged violation of Commission rules regarding leakage surveys.
Citation for alleged violation of Commission Rules Regarding External Corrosion Control.
Violations federal rules incorporated by the Illinois Commerce Commission regarding testing
Peoples Gas had failed to follow its procedures related to horizontal directional drilling.
Violations related to written emergency procedures and action protocols.
Citation for violations of federal safety requirements adopted in Illinois Administrative Code.

The Illinois Commerce Commission approved two landmark settlements under which $18.5 million would be paid to customers of Peoples Gas and the State of Illinois by Peoples and its parent company, Integrys Energy Group, owned by WEC Energy Group Inc. The settlements resolved investigations into statements made by representatives of Peoples, Integrys and WEC before the Commission concerning the estimated long-term cost of the Accelerated Main Replacement Program (AMRP). As part of the settlement, Peoples and Integrys admitted information was omitted, namely the preliminary cost estimate indicating the AMRP would cost more than $8 billion, from their discussion of the AMRP at the ICC's May 20, 2015 open meeting.
